The few things that aggravated me were that the Cullen's were downplayed. You do see them throughout the movie but it seemed like all together they only had like 30 or 40 lines. Jasper is the one that I was most disappointed in; Jackson does an excellent job but his power is never mentioned and looks like he was just thrown in to compliment Alice. Everyone else was amazing, the actors and the characters.

It's true that it doesn't follow the book to the letter but it was still an excellent movie. There are many missing scenes but it doesn't feel lacking. Things are kind of out of place or have been cut altogether, like when Bella tells Edward that she doesn't care that he's a vampire and to scare her off he shows what he looks like in the sunlight and his other abilities¬Öunlike the book where she knows and then on a sunny day he shows her what he looks like or how the biology scene where they type their blood is cut along with the scene in the airport where Bella runs away. Lunch scenes are short and it's never shown that Bella and Edward have lunch together or when she starts sitting with the Cullens.

The movie doesn't seem lacking but true-die hard fans might be disappointed when they don't see a scene because it was cut. All in all, Twilight is a movie that I know I will see again and again in theaters and buy on DVD. It's an amazing movie and I highly recommend it to anyone who asks.

title: Seriously bad even without comparison to the books.
review:
Let me begin this by saying that when the Twilight book first came out, some of my friends loved it, and I decided to buy and read it for myself. I finished Twilight feeling annoyed, pretty much dragged myself through New Moon, and didn't even try to read Eclipse or Breaking Dawn or whatever night-time-titled monster Meyer is planning to create.

Now, one of my friends had an extra ticket to a premiere of Twilight the movie, so I guessed, why not. I might actually like it now that we don't have to hear/read Bella's narration admire Edward's face/eyes/hair/breath/toenails time and time again (little did I know the film would include cheesy voice overs by a monotone Kristen Stewart straight from the novel).

To protect myself from the inevitable angry rages of hopelessly devoted Twilight fans, I will begin with the positive comments on this movie.

1. Pretty good visuals, nice colors.

2. Great soundtrack/music, especially when Edward plays the piano.

3. The actors playing the Cullens are all enjoyable, and because of their performances I grew pretty fond of the screen versions of Carlisle and Jasper.

4. They did a good job with the baseball game - when I read it in the book I just found it ridiculous.

Off to why I really wrote this review- to express my absolute hatred/disgust for the "acting skills" of Kristen Stewart. I don't understand all this raving over her performances, in this movie she was so unemotional and dead I thought she'd already been bitten by a vampire. And its not just the type of mediocre acting you can just brush away - her plain, expressionless face and deadpan voice was almost painful to watch in all of her scenes that were supposed to be dramatic. The only part it seems she put effort in to actually manipulate the muscles in her face or raise her voice was the last hospital scene, and even that didn't impress me that much. Yes, she did her job and screamed and writhed after James' bite, but couldn't I at least see those angry eyebrows tilt a little? Actually move? No Oscar for this one, folks.

The movie does its job to faithful novel fans by including real lines from the book itself and passionate, bubbling chemistry between the main characters Bella and Edward, so that probably made them not pay any attention to its flaws and declare this "PERFECT!!" or "D BEST MOVIE EVR!!!!!1!11!1"

Now I'm not telling everyone to hate this movie, I mean, if you enjoy it and like watching it, go ahead, I'm not complaining. But do not proclaim Twilight - The Movie as the best-created or best-acted or anything like that, because it's not true. Lastly, do not respond to this review in some irate, screaming, capitalized comment about how I'm stupid or I'm a loser for not liking Twilight, because I'm not even arguing with any fans.

title: This movie was really a gift
review: Twilight was one of the best movies I have ever seen. The romance in this movie was like no other romantic movies out. It was so original and well directed. The visuals went along with the movie great. I thought the title for the movie was great. I think the visuals made sense with a lot of the scenes. It did have a few sad moments and then very intense moments. The movie was very long but did not drag on at all. It was very entertaining and will definitely keep you awake and your eyes glued. The acting was very good but cheesy at very few scenes. I think the acting was meant to be cheesy at some of the scenes. The story was amazing and very original. The vampire falling in love with a human was a great plot to begin with. Their was more to the story then just that though. The movie wasn't only serious it also had quite a bit of humor in it as well. I would say definitely go see this movie and bring a date. One more last thing to add to this amazing movie is that their was really good music.

title: Unless you've read the book, don't go see the movie.
review:
Please tell me the director of this film is not directing the next one. All of her previous movies were terrible, she must be mormon because I don't know why stephanie would let her ruin this movie.

The movie is everything that everyone has been saying about it: Corny, unintentionally hilarious, awful dialogue, terrible acting (sorry girls, patterson is no exception, he was just as awful).

I think the main problem with this movie was that the directory tried to make it "audience friendly" meaning, make it easy for people who haven't read the books. Which is totally stupid because the main fan base is going to be the people who read the books, so why skimp on the material? The movie should have been longer, I felt that by the end of the movie there was BARELY a relationship developed between Bella and Edward. One fan pointed out that they never said 'i love you' once in the entire film. Whoever directs this next movie: you NEED to dedicate some serious time in the beginning of the movie to establishing a strong relationship between bella and edward, seeing as how edward is suppose to be ripped from bella in the next movie. The next director isn't going to get the point across effectively as to how devastating this is for bella unless they spend some time reworking the relationship.

So the movie made 70 million? put that toward some freakin' acting classes. Everyone in that movie was TERRIBLE! even kristen stewart did a less than par job. in the movie she's sitting there being like "i'm not afraid of you" and she's shaking and looking terrified.

Ultimately, there's nothing that can save twilight at this point, whats done is done. I just hope that the next director take some serious advice from the fans and works on making this movie better because it was severely disappointing.

title: My Reaction to Twilight
review: I am a huge fan of the books. That being said, I went into this movie with very low expectations, and was pleasantly surprised. I actually loved it. There were definitely major flaws, and it may not have captured the complete essence of the book, but it was simply fun to see so many of my favorite scenes brought to life. Could the acting have been a little better? Maybe. The directing? Probably. The special effects? Definitely. But overall this movie remains extremely faithful to the book. My opinion is that this movie, is definitely not FANTASTIC, but entertaining, and I don't see why so many twilighters are being so cruel in their judgment of it. Non-twilighters, i can understand. But I have been reading reviews from true twi-hards, some loved it, some loathed it. But for those who despised it, all i have to say is you dug your own graves. For months now I've been watching the videos of the fans reactions to this movie. They all guaranteed that the movie would be outstanding... perfect! But it hadn't even been released yet. Even I, a truly devoted fan, could tell from the trailers and clips, that this movie was not going to be outstanding. But then I would go and read people's comments to the trailers and they would be like "OMG! This is PERFECT! This is going to be so amazing!" The fact is, fans got their expectations set way too high, which is a terrible mistake when looking forward to a book adaptation. So the movie wasn't perfect! go read the books! watch the movie for the movie, and read the books when you want the perfect version, because it will only ever be perfect in your own heads. All i have to say is that these twilight fans seriously need to stop talking crap about this movie, or there will be no hope for making sequels. and despite the hatred by some fans toward the first movie, i know the majority of them would still like to see the sequels made into movies. For fans, go see this movie with an open mind, don't expect too much, and take it at face value for what it is, one person's interpretation of the book. For non fans, I don't really have any advice. Yes. This was a low budget movie, and it shows a little bit, but is still entertaining in MY opinion. I've known non-fans who hated the movie, as was the case with most the critics. But i've also known non-fans who really liked it. My brother has tried for months to finish the first book, never has, but actually really liked the movie. So it really just depends. Oh, and for people who hated the movie because bella was wearing the wrong color shirt in a particular scene, or someone was too pale, or not pale enough, all I have to say is, "You're being ridiculous. Get over yourself." One last thing, particularly for twilight fans, particularly for those who hated the film. Go see it again. I've seen it twice already, and it truly was better the second time. I forgot about all the little things, and the fact that the first time i saw it, it felt a bit like a rushed summary of the book. The second time it played more like a movie, with it's own unique feel, however different that may be from the book, and I enjoyed it even more than the first time. I bet you will too. Try it!

title: Bella Swan moves from Arizona to Forks, Washington, where she meets a mysterious guy named Edward Cullen. It's a teenage love story, with some very different elements.
review: I saw this movie this morning at 10 am. This movie was fantastic! I thought that the acting was very well done and the people that they picked to play the characters were great. I didn't think that I'd like Nikki Reed as Rosalie, but I really did once I saw how she portrayed her. I can't wait for the next movie! There were some great funny scenes too which made everyone in the theater laugh. The way they filmed the flying/running scenes were very well done. You just fall in love with these characters and if you've read the books then this movie was definitely not a let done. Overall it was a fantastic movie and I would recommend it to everyone!

title: Always love Twilight even if it wasn't a 10
review: ... I really tried not to compare the book to movie because duh the book is always better besides that, like many other fans something was missing certain parts could have been cut out and added to the build up of the romanc. Yes i Know it was geared toward that tween age group but foolish for them to think only tweens were in love with Twilight.. I am in my twenty's and i expected more as a twilight obsesser i want to love it but it just wasn't there... If you didn't read the book i cant see someone appreciating it simply because its a twilight thing :) Well i think part problem is the director..bad translation...and Some bad acting! Still loved Edward n Bella's interaction if New Moon turns out like this ill be sleeping when Edwards away... Edward made the movie.. Was hoping for more Still left with a smile and thought it was cute but it should have dazzled me to the point of no compare... Im scared that New Moon Might not do as good because it wont draw out the non-readers, ratings might be a slump because there probably not twilighters! But as a loyal twilight fan i am still going to see it mulitple times!! I will review after i see it again i think it will be better. And Randomn Stephanie Meyer Moment eating pie

title: Could it have gone worse? I think not.
review: This is one of those cases where the movie is better than the book, and though that sounds good,its not saying much. Even so, the movie is absolutely horrible. Moments that looked rather like the director didn't even take the movie seriously himself- when Bella first sits next to Edward is one- and bad acting cannot make up for a bland, and as others have said, predictable story. If one were to have just seen the movie,I'm sure there were many plot holes as well, like WHY the black vampire was traveling with two such dangerous vampires in the first place, and if he did know why did he not join them. This movie isn't worth the money I spent, much less going to the midnight showing- though I must admit when the movie started going backwards and upside down, it was pretty good. What? That wasn't part of the movie? Just a technical error? Dang, then this movie has no entertainment value. Also, to the girl two rows down from me in the theater, this movie, nor its book counterweight, are not even close to being compared to The Lord of The Rings.

title: An Honest Review
review:
OK, Full disclosure, I love Harry Potter. yes, I'm an old man that works in history and loves a children's novel. And the people (at least the women) that I know that also loved Harry Potter loved Twilight.

So I gave it a try, much like I did "Lord of the Rings."

My problem with the books, well the one that I read, was that it was like a romance novel with vampires...and cut away at all the best parts. All the reasons why you read romance novels...gone from "Twilight" and instead you just have the build up.

And the same can be said about the movie (the one that I watched).

Plus, I have an issue with Anne Rice style vampires anyways, they live off of blood. They realistically have every BBP on earth anyway. They shouldn't be pretty.

title: Help Everyone
review: NOPE. NOPE. NOPE. NOPE. Oh look a NOPEmovie. If you ever come across this film in your travels, do the world a favor; take it from where you have found it, set it gently on the ground, take a machine gun and unload a round or two into it. After you've finished with that, scoop up the remains, then transport those remains to the nearest fire. When there is nothing but ashes left, sweep up those ashes and deposit them into a container of acid. Take that container of acid and travel to the deepest body of water you can find and release that acid into the middle of it. Then we can rest assured it can't hurt anyone else. You can help all of your fellow humans by deciding to take these simple steps to avoid the pain and suffering. Thank you.

title: LOVE between human and vampire
review:
This movie was new to me. Actually my favorite genre of movie is romance, but i couldn't think about love of human and vampire.

The movie was very impressive and interesting at the same time.

First, the plot was exciting. It made me keep thinking toward the end, 'How will they finish this?'

Second, Robert Panttinson. He became my favorite actor in Hollywood. He just nailed the role of Edward. Especially, when Edward protected Bella from the danger of sliding car and the school parking lot. I wanted to meet a vampire boyfriend.

I watched this movie five times-three times at the movie theater and two times at home. And i downloaded the movie as soon as it was uploaded on the Internet. Also i bought book series of the movie:Twilight, New moon, Eclipse, and breaking dawn.

I truly recommend this movie to high school girls like me.

title: Why does Twilight have such a low rating?
review: I don't understand why Twilight has such a low rating. I like to watch movies, I have seen a lot and I like quality films. I have always heard Twilight is more for women so it's only until yesterday since I have watched part 1, and I don't think it's a 'chick flick'. I really enjoyed the movie. I have just finished part 2 and I'll watch part 3 in a moment. I don't care if Twilight doesn't make sense to some people. It is a movie, it doesn't have to make sense. To me Twilight is it's own world just like the Lord of the Rings, just Like Harry Potter, and I think the movie tells a nice story in it's own way and I think the story makes sense. I've enjoyed the acting too. The 5,3 rating is too low!

title: A Classic Love Story With A Twist
review:
Up until three years ago I never heard of this movie or read the books by Stephanie Meyer it was only after i borrowed the film from my sister that I saw why people fell in love with it. Twilight tells the story of a modern day teenage girl who falls in love with a vampire it was the best epic romance film in years.

Robert Pattinson & Kristen Stewart portray the star crossed couple pretty well they have great chemistry on screen their performance throughout the film was amazing.Pattinson's the sexiest vampire I've seen since Brad Pitt in 1994's Interview With The Vampire, the scenery and action sequences were visually incredible.

I have all four books in the series as well as the films and can't wait until Breaking Dawn comes out in theatres and then on DVD.

At 17 years old Bella Swan (Stewart) is different she's never been one to run with the popular kids at her school or be part of a social clique that consists of snobby girls.When she moves to Forks, Washington to live with her father chief of police Charlie (Burke)she doesn't expect too much to happen,however the course of her life is about to change forever.

On her first day of school she makes new friends with Mike (Welch) Jessica (Kendrick), Eric (Chon) and Angela (Serratos) Bella becomes intrigued when she sees the Cullen siblings including 17 year old Edward (Pattinson) a boy with a dark secret. After some research and occurrences where he possesses quick speed and strength she finds out he's a vampire, in 1918 he was on the verge of death due to Spanish influenza in order to save him his adoptive father Carlisle (Facinelli) transformed him so he would forever remain a teenager. As their different worlds and hearts collide he struggles with the lust burning inside him and deals with a trio of deadly vampires who want to harm his girlfriend.

she also meets the rest of his family mother Esmee (Reaser), brothers Jasper (Rathbone) & Emmett (Lutz)then finally his sisters Alice (Greene) who treats Bella like a sister and Rosalie (Reed) who dislikes her because she's human.

For fans of romantic fantasy and action Twilight is a crowd pleaser sure to entertain legions of fans everywhere

7/10

title: One of the greatest modern love stories
review: I became a fan of the Twilight series in 2008. I read the first book in the series and then I saw the movie version. Soon after I became obsessed with Twilight. I own lots of merchandise including the soundtracks, movies, pins, key chains and the official movie guides. I have seen Twilight 18 times. Some people hate Twilight but have no reason to. I thought Twilight was an excellent, funny, intense and romantic love story. It's a big movie but feels like a smaller movie. It's Beauty and the Beast meets Romeo and Juliet. I thought Edward and Bella were a great couple. Bella's Father Charlie is one of my favorite characters. I did not like at first when Edward was being jerky to Bella but he was trying to protect her. I love the fight scene at the end in the ballet studio. I think the movie has great songs. James was a great villain but he could have had more scenes. I thought it was creepy when he noticed Bella was a human. Edward is my favorite Cullen and I like Alice and Jasper a lot. I thought the dancing scene was beautiful and I like when Edward saves Bella from the men that noticed her in the dress shop. I think everyone should give Twilight a shot. It's for anyone who likes romance and fantasy.

title: Best Vampire Story Ever !!
review:
I saw other Twilight saga first so I'm biased in this review. If this was the first Twilight I've seen, it would have been much difficult to understand the story.

Bella moved from Phoenix Arizona to Forks Washington. There she enters high school, and meets Edward. Edward is bit unusual, and Bella suspects that there's more to him than what he's willing to tell, but she can't exactly pin point to what it is. In the mean time, there's strange killing going on in the forest. Edward finally confesses that he's a vampire, but of a "vegetarian" kind, and don't kill humans. They both fall in love with each other. One day, the "other" vampires who's been killing people in the forest shows up, and wants to "eat" Bella. Edward tries to defend her, but they got her mom, and by her own volition, she goes to meet the vampires.

I usually don't go for vampire movies, especially the old school kind, but this is story done elegantly, with romance, intrigue, and action. This is the first vampire movie that I really liked. Story develops rather slowly, and it's good that series continued, because not enough is said in this first installment. Picture is beautiful, and casts are best of the young actors.

Great movie, that should be seen as a series. Otherwise you'll miss the good parts.

title: Stole My Heart!
review:
I saw the trailer for this movie while I was watching another one and I scoffed at it. I purposely ignored the Harry Potter craze and saw Twilight as the same sort of situation. However, the trailer left me intrigued. I decided to just take a look at this movie just to see what all of the fuss was about.

It's official, I have been bitten by the Twilight bug. I fell head over heels, madly, passionately and irrevocably in love with Edward and Bella. Their love story is so different than the usual teen drama, and not just because it contains hunky vampires (that's just a bonus). It's mature, lacking the usual mundane teenager drama. You almost forget that they are supposed to be in high school and see them as two adults beginning an incredible but dangerous journey.

There isn't a lot of action but I didn't miss it. This movie isn't like The Lost Boys, filled with death and terror. It's a love story great for all ages.

Robert Pattinson is wonderful as the breathtaking Edward, the vampire torn between his love for Bella and his fear of killing her because of her blood's enticing scent. Kristen Stewart plays the mature and klutzy Bella. She plays her character perfectly, showing her as completely spellbound to Edward and quite willing to accept this mythical world she as stumbled upon, even hoping to become a part of one day. I look forward to seeing her in New Moon when Bella's emotional journey takes a serious hit.

After seeing the movie I collected all of the books and I am happy to say that it's not that different. Sure there are additions and several subtractions to the story, but all in all the characters and plots were untouched. I recommend this movie to all of whom are undecided about reading the books. Once the credits roll you'll be heading to the book store, I guarantee it.

title: ROFL glossy vampires and telepathy werewolves WTF?
review:
This must be the worst vampire movie ever i mean omg? Everybody cried out laughing after seeing Edward the little vampire. His first appearance made him look like he was shitting himself(not kidding).

The acting sucked ass! The script was bad and well lets not kid around the books are bad 2! In the books every sentence starts with: I went... I talked..so I did.. I ate.. i saw.. really bad! And the skin of a killer? omg i had to laugh so hard the roof Wat about to collapse. Some gay guy with a shiny skin like he used a little bit to much glossy on his head. What happened about creepy vampires? in stead of glitters they should have seen veins and stuff. Anyway I hate this movie it sucked ass but apparently my girlfriend seems to like it..which is driving me nuts. She bought all the books and for part 2 we have werewolves that are communicating with telepathy instead of the original more sense howling. the woman who wrote these books should commit suicide.. she's messing up the whole vampire werewolf legends with glossy faced vampires and telepathy werewolves i mean wtf was she thinking..probably stoned or on drugs or something. Anyway people stay away from this movie or if u really want to get someone u hate to have a bad evening with urges to commit suicide..i would suggest giving them this DVD on their birthday! It was really horrible to watch...and not in the good way!

title: If you were 10 this might seem OK, or if u liked dragon wars
review:
What a waste of time!!! It has some interesting ideas, that never form anything. the story is non-existent, and the acting was crap. AND .... what is up with the crappy make up??? A lot of white make-up and no one notices that they look like a white board????

horrible waste of time.... why am i even bothering to write about it???? See for yourself, just expect to be disappointed.

if u like this and are over 14 there is something seriously wrong with you...

lol i bet u will watch this just be cause of the bad comments~~ I know people like that

title: very poor
review: If you are 9 and crazy about the books then you will like this movie. If you are an adult and haven't read the books (and perhaps even if you have read them) don't bother watching this. It is very mundane, very poorly acted and I couldn't wait for it to be over. It is one of the worst movies I have ever watched. A huge disappointment. The story is somewhat predictable, the main female character is not believable. She has no trouble believing in vampires and is not surprised by all of this at all. The main male character is a horrible actor. My dog could say the lines better than he does. Excuse my ramblings, but I needed 10 lines in order to post.

title: Waste of Money...Wait Until It Comes To Video
review:
My boyfriend, Shawn wanted to go see "Twilight", (I know it sounds odd being a girl and all, but it wasn't MY idea to see this. I wanted to make that very clear so that he doesn't blame ME for this waste of money), so we went to a matin√©e showing of it yesterday afternoon.

At least, Shawn and I were in agreement at the end of the flick: What a waste of fifteen bucks!

I mean, seriously, if you really wan to see this piece of trash at least wait until it's out on video or comes to a cable channel. It has some clever ideas, I will admit, but the execution fell apart. Maybe if they had a different director, I don't know.

The plot was stupid and unrealistic, (there are plenty of fantasy/horror movies that get their audience to believe what's happening), the acting abysmal and the characters themselves were as dry and empty as my soul after enduring this two hour long bore-fest.

Shawn and I both had a laugh at the "glittering" vampire though. He made a short list of things Vampires should NOT do when they come in contact with sunlight:

When In Contact With Sunlight Vampires Do Not:

1. Glitter 2. Do 'The Robot' 3. Fart wishes and dreams

What they should do:

1. Burst into flames 2. Turn to ash 3. Catch on fire/burst into flames 4. Die 5. Any variation of the above.

If you really are set to go see this, don't take it too seriously and just enjoy the special effects. They had some nice special effects, I'll give them that much. For suggestions on a few GOOD vampire movies:

"Near Dark", "The Lost Boys", "Innocent Blood" and "Interview with a Vampire" to name just a few. Note that none of the vampires in any of these films ever sparkled or glittered in the sunlight. ~rolls eyes~.

Movie Grade: C- (At least it had some cool effects!)

I think I'll skip the books, too.

~Ami

title: Excellent
review: I myself have read the books and am a big fan of Twilight. I was praying that Hardwick wouldn't crew this up and my prayers were answered. The movie was ten times better than what I had expected. The last ten minutes sent butterflies pounding through my stomach. Many people have looked down on this movie saying it doesn't match what they expected. The only negative would be the rush I saw. Some of the concepts in the book were "rushed" in the movie. For example, Edward mentioned Alice being psychic so quickly, you could have easily missed it. Over all the movie was amazing. I really love Kristen and Rob together. They made a great couple. The movie never really ads or takes away anything major. I think the entire crew did a great job making this. Bravo Catherine Hardwick!

title: Absolutely painfully bad!
review:
OK, so I read the 4 books in 5 days while my husband was out of town. They are certainly not going to be classics, but I will admit that I (mostly) enjoyed them.

I dragged the hubby to see the movie tonight, and let's just say it was payback for the time he made me see Silent Hill

First off it was totally miscast. Bella could not complete a sentence to save her life, and was absolutely unappealing. Edward was supposed to be the most beautiful and charming man on earth, instead he was a clumsy and bizarro stalker There was zero chemistry between them...and their chemistry is kind of the basis of the book. Jasper looked and acted like a constipated Edward Scissorhands. Esme was sweet and at least looked about like I would have expected. The other Cullens were not in the movie enough to decide if I liked them or not.

The special effects and makeup were just weird! The flying, jumping, climbing, & running stuff I swear they just looked to be dangling from cords. The big ballet studio fight was passable...only the bad guy James was just not that bad...and the end where Edward sucks the venom out??? Good Lord it was bad.

If I were Catherine Hardwicke I would be very very ashamed. The screenplay must have been God awful...

In short, I alternated between embarrassed for everyone involved, verging on hysterical laughter from beginning to end, and thinking that I should have just gotten my $10 worth and hopped into the next theater where Changeling was playing.

If you liked the book stay far far away from this movie

title: Horrible-Almost left halfway through
review:
Wow, really bad!! I had high hopes going in to see this, as I've read and enjoyed all the books. The characters were nothing like the books. Am I wrong, but were there any Asian or Blacks in the book? I don't think so. Stop trying to make everything politically correct. I couldn't even tell which characters were which because of this. There are no hipster, emo kids in Forks either. Rosalie was all wrong, not nearly pretty enough. Bella had no facial expressions whatsoever, and every word that came out of her mouth was preceded by stuttering and hemming and hawing. Horrble! Alice, Emmett, and Edward were good.

Not sure what else to say. I really didn't like it and was very disappointed. I will probably see the other movies, but just wait until they are on video to rent.

title: Waste of time! Utter CHEESE!!!!!
review:
Boring, Slow & Cheesy...... This movie had woman written all over it. It was slow moving, not scary, not mysterious and most definitely not sexy. Surely vampires should be all of those things. This book is disrespectful toward all literary traditions created by classical Gothic and horror writers.

Vampires burn in the sunlight, don't they? Or are all of the movies and books I've read wrong?. Obviously Miss Meyer disagrees with those books and thinks that vampires 'sparkle' in the sunlight. I mean wtf.

The book and movie were clearly written for young girls (fan girls), that like things such as Camp Rock and the Jonas Brothers. The over romanticising of every little detail is sickening. What has happened to real horror stories and classic movies such as Terence Fisher's Dracula (starring Christopher Lee)?

Twilight could have been an amazing and successful production, if it had a good director and a good cast. The book had an OK storyline -apart from the sparkling in the sun. The vampires have no weakness, every good hero has a weakness- but this was clearly only made for the fan girls.

It doesn't deserve the one star that i gave it, but there is no option to give it 0 unfortunately.

This movie is a disgrace, an utter waste of time and an insult to all the vampires out there ;)

title: Twilight: A Beautiful Love Story
review: I just came from watching Twilight. I'm a huge fan of the books but I wasn't expecting the movie to impress me. Everybody knows that the books are always better than the movie because there is no way to capture all the magic in a 500 pages book in 2 hours. At first I didn't even liked the cast and the trailers didn't help either. I was expecting to be disappointed. I thought I was going to watch how the unique but amazing love story of Bella and Edward was destroyed and turned into a cheap movie that focuses on attracting vampire and action lovers by Hollywood. I thought they didn't care about the fans of the books who were impressed not by the action scenes but by the while romance and love in the book. I was wrong. To my surprise the movie did catch the magic in the book, that essence that makes us love them. I actually enjoyed it a lot! I also thought this entire buzz and over-exposure was going to set high expectations and then disappoint everybody because that's what always happens when a movie is surrounded with all that hype. I was wrong again. The movie met all my expectations and more. I really got caught up in the chemistry between Bella and Edward. I just can say it was a beautiful movie to watch. It was far from perfect and it was not the same experience as to read the book but it was definitely a great film. I watched Twilight with my cousin and he had no idea what the books were about. He only knew what the trailers showed. To my surprise he loved it too! He was more satisfied and excited about the movie than I was! In conclusion I think Twilight met its purpose and will overwhelm all the fans of the books and the ones who haven't read them. For me Twilight was a hit and it was able to bring to the big screen in 2 hours the love story of a vampire and a human successfully. The movie will definitely leave you hungry for the sequels. I have to tell you that I was always on the edge of my sit. I never felt bored or uninterested. Even though I knew the story very well I was filled with excitement and anticipation during the whole film. I was impressed how fast the action moves without missing vital details form the book. It was awesome that the movie followed the book so closely. I was so happy they didn't change anything huge. At the end of the day I was ecstatic because I never expected it to be that good. It was romantic, mysterious and funny all at the same time. Even though the cast has been highly criticized I think they did a pretty decent job. It was not perfect, it could've been better, but it was good enough. Right now I'm telling you to go see it if you haven't 'cause it's a beautiful film that won't let you down. For all of you that have seen it and disagree with me, it's fine. This is just my opinion (and my cousin's: P) and all of us are entitled to have one. I know a lot of people did not like the movie and at first I was skeptical too. But it was just so amazing I couldn't help but love it. And this is just the beginning. After this, I just can't wait for the sequels because I think they will get better and better as the go along.

title: Just let go, and enjoy.
review: I went into this not expecting the book, every one of my favorite books that have been made into movies never compare. Northanger abbey, per say. Saying that though does not make the movies better or worse then the book. It's just another way to tell a story. Twilight did that. Told this love story in a different way. You know that giraffe in the room illustration...every one describes it different...this is just another view of the giraffe. No it was not as descriptive as the books, some scenes, some quotes, were not the same but the point of it all came across well though. These two creatures are being pulled to each other, and they can not stop it. The way the scenes were shot made me feel like this was real, like I could walk into a school and yep there could be vampire. If it had been some great big budget film with grand effects, it would have felt corny, fake. Don't get me wrong, this movie was still a little cheesy, little sugary, but that was the same with the book...it's a great story. I think if you go into the movie not expecting everything just like the book, you'll enjoy. The ideas are the same. Don't nit pick, because you'll just miss Edwards smile Rob did very well. I was surprised the jittery, yet adorable, Rob Patterson was able to play graceful quiet Edward, but the first moment he smiled he was Edward. Kristen was amazing as Bella, there really is a connection between her and Rob, and it makes the scenes that much more enjoyable and real. Ashley as Alice, was perfect, and the chemistry between her and Jason/Jasper was also amazing, the small things they did such as her touching his arm, really showed them as a couple. I can't wait to see more of their story in the future. I think if you watch some of the small details throughout the movie, you will see more then you think is there just look. The rest of the cast was amazing, and though at first i wasn't sure how anyone could play Rosalie, Nikki did a great job. All I'm saying is, it's worth seeing, as long as you know how to let go of the book, and see this through someone's eyes other then your own. Just let go, don't think, and enjoy a great movie. I hope to see the other made in the same fashion.

title: Very enjoyable love story!
review:
OK, so I never read the books but have heard a lot about it. I myself am a huge fan of vampire based stories. When I was little Interview with a Vampire was my favorite movies! (yes I saw it when I was like in 4th grade and really that was more of an adult movie but I grew up with movies part of why I'm studying film) That's what started my obsession with vampires at a young age, then when I was in 5th grade in 1997 Buffy the Vampire Slayer came out (the show not the movie never saw that till after I'd been watching the show for a few years and yea not that good) I was so addicted and became my first real fandom and first time having an obsession with a show.

After Buffy I've loved most other vampire movies for the most part and then when Moonlight came on I LOVED that show so much! So mad they canceled it and now there is True Blood which well I'm not really a fan of I've been watching it and it's not that I don't like it I just don't know if I like it yet, it hasn't hooked me.

So hearing all this stuff about Twilight from people who had been reading the books I was excited and finally when a trailer came out I couldn't wait to see it, so I looked it up on youtube and umm yea it did nothing for me. The trailer made me not even want to see the movie it just looked like some stupid little teeny booper movie that deals with some vampire stuff in it. Though I was still left intrigued by all I heard so tonight my boyfriend, his sister and me went to see the midnight showing and WOW was I surprised!!!! None of us have read the book but we all loved it!! My boyfriend for being a guy loved it even though it was very romantic and I was gonna say sappy but really I didn't find it sappy or corny. My boyfriend's sister got out of a four year relationship awhile ago and has been one of those "I hate love and romantic things" person, but she loved the movie! When we got out of the movie tonight she said how she doesn't like stuff about love anymore but the romance in this movie was just too beautiful not to love it and it was her favorite movie! And really I thought that this movie was one of the most romantic movies I've seen of all times! Just the chemistry between Kristen and Robert is just so beautiful! I don't think I've ever seen chemistry that great which isn't saying that I haven't thought other two actors had great chemistry before but there was just something magical about them that brought it up to a whole new level.

Sure, the film may not be perfect and I can't really judge it based on the books but for what it's worth it is one of the best love stories!

title: Don't Hesitate - WATCH THIS despite what others may say
review: Twilight was extremely popular with romantics and teenage college crowd including housewives. Loving SciFi and Romance I gave it a shot being a movie lover since forever. My daughter had read the books and loved it and I trusted her taste being a Christian. I was hooked. Kristen Stewart makes the series, but the casting crew did an outstanding job. From Alice's perky personality to Jasper always looking like he's in pain I was really impressed. Having seen thousands of movies from all era's Its hard to move me or surprise me this series of movies did just that. I had to watch it several times to catch some things. My wife is much more observant than I am but she still has not seen them. I think she's afraid she might like them. I was an Edward fan, but Jacob is hard to dislike. Each character is perfectly played and the dialog intriguing. You will experience a full range of emotion from laughing out loud to feelings of loss and empathy for each character. It will tick you off and make you smile. Don't go in with any expectations and let the movie take you on a great ride into fantasy and friendship and family and you name it. Be a man watch it. Even if by remote chance you don't think its great at least you can finally talk about it intelligently when you hear someone reference the movie or its referenced in another movie or trivia game. I just watch Kristen's movie Equals and was impressed again. I may be a sucker for SciFi and Romance, but though many said it was predictable don't believe it for a moment.

title: amazing a must see movie the yes PG13
review: it is a amazing movie it is a must see movie it is the best PG13 movie ever made you will never want the movie to end it is incredible you will say wow lets watch that again it was a super movie you will die after you see this amazing movie it really is the best PG13 movie i think so you just have to watch this awesome movie Twilight is the best movie ever made this movie should win some awards it is that good i never saw a movie this good in my life it is the best movie ever created this is the best you will have to watch this amazing movie that everyone will fall in love with it is a outstanding movie it is the best movie ever made it is a home run movie it is out of this world amazing it should be the number 1 movie ever made it is that good of a movie i never saw a movie like this in my life it is a movie that everyone will be talking about in a few years i never saw a movie quite this good before you will enjoy watching this outstanding movie have a great day everyone you want be sorry

title: Loved the movie, look forward to a better movie in New Moon
review:
The movie was beautifully cast with very talented actors who worked with what they had. The screenplay left much to be desired. Rob Pattinson and Kristen Stewart - in fact every cast member was incredible - was the strongest part of the movie. The chemistry between Rob & Kristen is unbelievable - and as one reviewer said - he'd be surprised if they didn't get together some day (me too!!). There is no-one else who could play these characters. That being said, Catherine directed this as a teen movie - she had an excellent feel for the high school atmosphere, and Rob and Kristen played some scenes to the hilt - some scenes were so staccato - it definitely left you wanting for more. When Edward jumps on her pick-up, when he brings her to school, when she sees his room for the first time (some of the best scenes in the movie)it's as if Catherine Hardwicke couldn't move on fast enough to the next scene. You want to savor their relationship - enjoy the build-up - her dreaming and talking about him, him being affected by that and you never can. In the book,Bella talks in her sleep all the time and that is a turning point for Edward falling in love with her - for his hope of loving her and they totally dropped it, you rarely see him in her room, in the book it's the backbone of their relationship. They wasted too much time on James (out of town attacks) and having people run up the hill. The baseball scene was well done, as well as Bella and Edward in the treetops.

I know with a bigger budget and some intelligent translation between Stephenies brilliant books and the screenplay - as to what is really important here Edward and Bella and their undeniable connection, you'll satisfy the mature fan base (which I am convinced is the major fan base). These are not just for teens, these books are as mature as any love story out there. Edward and Bella would die for each other and though all of the devotee's out there understand this, the connection was not built up well in the movie at all. Rob & Kristen conveyed that with sheer talent and chemistry - this movie could have been at least 20-30 minutes longer and they could have given this romance it's proper build-up. A Love anyone would give their life for - and that is why people are so crazy for it. I don't know why Catherine Hardwicke was so ashamed of that angle - it's like guys are too, but I've seen plenty of men in the theater - so SOME MEN admit that they might actually be interested in Love.

Robert and Kristin - Edward and Bella personified, both extremely talented, gifted people - and I can only wait, with extreme anticipation for the three sequels coming up - each better than the last! They are so lucky, these films will be the best films they ever do, roles of a lifetime, their Titanic, their Braveheart, their Romeo and Juliet - it's unfortunate that the great roles happen so early, but what an opportunity and Kristen and Rob have it - in the palm of their hands. These books have sold millions and there is a reason why - Hope -we all want what Edward and Bella have, perfect, indivisible, Love.

title: Loved it
review: I saw this movie before reading the book and thought it was wonderful. The books however, are even more incredibly good than this movie, although I think it got most of the story in. What you have to think about when seeing a movie based on a novel, you must accept that a book can go on and on, while a movie needs a timeframe. shrinking all those pages down to a movie isn't easy, I think it's caught some of the essence though I will agree that it doesn't capture it all. All in all, I think it was a very beautiful movie. The romance is way more deep in the books, to that I agree, but I was a smitten kitten throughout the movie =) Just enjoy it for what it is, I say.

title: Great!
review: I thought it was fantastic! Robert and Kristin have great chemistry and i love how it left you wondering what they were thinking. Also The score was brilliant for the movie i bought both albums and i love them! However i did think the glittery skin part was a bit much that isn't how Stephanie Meyer's made it sound in the book but for the budget they had i give them an A+..I mean a budget of 38 million to make a movie with vampires.... they did good job. I loved it and have yet to meet a person i introduced it to not to feel the same way. Matter of fact most of them started reading the books b\c of it. Bottom line is it's a cult classic movie it isn't going away so deal with the beauty that is Twilight!!!

title: Except only one time I almost vomit, I would say this movie is one of the worst movies ever...
review: If I had vomit would be the worst by far. At least the pop corn was good and company kept me awake from sleep. And I still need to write down 10 lines? I don't know what guys wait from this movie but I am sure its a girl movie. so if u ask me the only thing this movie is good for is to let your girlfriend go and watch it as u will be free to go out and have a nice time. Or cheat on her too, its 2 hours and some minutes, long for everything u need... I hope there wont be a sequence too. better to download beverly hills episodes and watch them again. I don't know if this all is junk I write, but I just made an account to save some ppl. 1 out of 10... sometimes i hope I could vote for 0.

title: Not your typical teenage love story....
review:
I didn't know what Twilight was about when I first saw the previews for it. I honestly thought it was just another romantic movie. There was just so much talk about it, I saw it EVERYWHERE: posters, the books, trailers, ads, and merchandise.

I finally gave in and decided to go see it with my sister. By the time the movie was over, I came out a fan. Now, I'm completely obsessed with it. I was truly surprised.

Many people say the graphics or make up or whatever else could have been better, but under the circumstances of only having about $30 million to go off of is not bad. It could have never been made at all. This movie is mainly about love, its not an action movie so who cares if the main fight scene wasn't as good as some people wanted.

While watching the movie the actors displayed emotions that many of us have experienced. Many of us can relate. The actors came through in that, it's as though they truly felt that way.

It seems as though in this generation, any teen movie or even any movie anymore has some sort of unnecessary "love" scenes of any type. Like they have to have a kiss that is 'out of control', or the girls wear skimpy out-fits and 'rub' on a guy, or scenes that imply them going to or having sex. There is always a love interest even though it's the smallest bit of detail in the story.

What I like about the movie Twilight is it's so deep, yet it's clean. The girls dress like typical girls in high school, having crushes, and going on dates. There isn't extra scenes with other couples making out in the background or the Cullens wearing skimpy outfits to imply visually that they are extremely beautiful.

I know that later on in Breaking Dawn, there is (sex), but it's not like it was just put in because it would draw an audience. It just went with the story and how Stephanie Meyer wrote it.

I absolutely love the movie, it's definitely top on my list.

title: My Twilight review
review:
Critics have been giving lukewarm reviews of Twilight for a lack of action, blood and gore. My question to them is "Have you read the books?" The book is a love story about a girl who falls in love with a boy who happens to be a vampire and the obstacles they need to overcome. Granted the movie wasn't perfect but with a budget of only 37 million, I think they did a darn good job representing the book, also the movie has Stephenie's blessing. Does it follow the book precisely, no, but what book to movie adaption ever does? The movie stays true to the essence of the characters and the story. If they fit the whole book into the movie, that would be a four hour movie, now, being an avid Twilight fan, I wouldn't have minded that one bit.

There were a few scenes in the movie where I felt the actors could have enunciated their lines a bit more clearly, also some of the "glowering" scenes were a bit over the top being laughed at by the audience. But was that the fault of Rob overacting or Catherine's fault for lack of direction? (maybe I should try to glower with orange contacts in my eyes) I felt the movie flowed well with the bit of tweaking done from book to script. I would have liked to see the part at the caf√©' in Port Angeles where Bella tells Edward to stop dazzling people and him asking her if he dazzles her to which her answer is "Frequently" If you read Midnight Sun on Stephenie Meyer's website that is a pivotal turn for Edward. I felt that was important.

When Edward enters the sunlight, it has more of a glittery look. Perhaps a better look would have been that of an opal with the rainbows reflecting off him? (I saw on another post site that several people agreed with my opal look for the vampires) I could have done without the "sparkle" sound affect in the movie. Tell me, does a Swarovski crystal make a sound when it catches the sunlight and sparkles? I just thought it was a cheesy addition.

I would have liked to see Edward dedicate Bella's lullaby to her and hear it in its pure form, just the piano, Edward and Bella.

The kiss scene in Bella's room was so electric you could feel the tension building in your own body and when their lips finally consummated their love... WOW! There is definitely a powerful chemistry between these two actors bringing more to this movie than if they didn't.

I liked the scenes of James' coven hunting bringing more depth to the "bad" vampires. Collecting mementos from their prey was brilliant.

I enjoyed it for what it is. A book to movie adaption and a getaway from the real world for two hours that I liked VERY much.

title: Not that bad, but could have been better
review:
Overall it was a good film. From what I heard, people who did not read the book(s) thought that it was a great film. I on the other hand thought that it was not as good as the non-readers say because I read the books.

The only complaint that I have is that there was a lack of detail to the story and they did not elaborate as much on the characters and their backgrounds as much as they could have. Other than that I thought that it was a good film. An extra half hour or so could have made it complete and a bit less choppy. I hope that they do that for the next film and focus on the character relationships. The director could have also done a better job of helping with the chemistry between the Bella and Edward, and could have made Edward less stiff and much more apprehensive to the relationship. They also could have included the other characters within the lives of Bella and Edward and how they play into the story and the lives of the two main characters. Maybe a new director for the next film?

title: Oh. Umm... Really?
review:
I'm sorry to say that this was a wasted opportunity for Stephanie Meyer and the Twilight franchise. The books have so much potential to be great movies and unfortunately, Ms. Hardwicke has seemed to miss out on some essential tones from the books. For example, if someone had never read the books, they would wonder why Bella and Edward are so quickly drawn to one another and - even having read the books - their relationship on screen is just...awkward.

When I read the books, the relationship between Bella and Edward drew me in so completely, I felt like I was emotionally involved with their story. (Granted, the writing could have been cleaner, but I'm not going to comment on the books here).

I understand Catherine Hardwicke had to compress about 600 pages into a 2 hour movie, but the movie's audience only gets to see a fraction of the pure *lust* between Edward and Bella - even *I* had trouble sleeping after reading the books. And that leads to my biggest disappointment of the movie - Bella's Lullaby. The melody plays throughout the movie, but the audience has NO idea of the significance! Bella's lullaby comes up on a number of occasions throughout the novels (and no doubt through the movies that will be produced), but Hardwicke chose to skim over the scene at the Cullen's house - truly one of the more memorable chapters in the books. It's a shame that more attention was not given to Bella and Edward's poignant fascination with each other.

I think the real problem with the movie is that you only get the very basics of the story line. You will not see nearly as much character development from the movie as you will from the books. After a start like this, it's very hard to imagine how the other three movies will manage to hold any type of significance.

Having said that, people *will* see the other three movies.

When I saw Twilight in theatre, there was a group of teenage girls behind me who actually *squeeled* and giggled with Edward's first appearance on screen. You can't escape the success of this franchise, built from the novels. As I mentioned, the other movies will be made; let's just hope the writers and directors learn a lesson from a somewhat dismal beginning.

title: Best Movie!!!
review: I honestly walked into this movie thinking it was going to be mediocre. This movie far exceeded my expectations, I loved it. It was unexpectedly funny and actually followed the book somewhat. The actors were also unexpectedly really good and played out there parts quite well. The best part for me was the biology scene it was so funny because Edward looked truly repulsed, and disgusted at the site of Bella. I would highly recommend anyone to watch this movie! The scenic view was absolutely beautiful, stunning if I may add. Wow! how beautiful Forks, Washington is I would like to go there sometime just because of how this movie made it look. I will definitely watch this movie again, it's worth it!

title: A Perfect Movie for all!!!!
review: I am definitely a Twihard. After a long countdown to release day, my friends and i screamed our way to the long line to the theatre that would show Twilight after school. All day, people were nagging me about how it got awful reviews and was "the worst movie ever made". I went into the theatre not knowing what to expect, and what I got was a wonderful movie experience, filled with fright, squeals, sighs, and a surprising amount of laughter. All the fan girls loved it, and I even caught the skeptical teen guys who were dragged there by friends or girlfriends (guiltily) enjoying themselves. It never leaves you bored, and strayed away from the book at the perfect amount- to follow and be riveted by the plot, but not ruining the book with too much Hollywood. I hope this movie does very well, and I can't wait for the sequels! It is a cinematic experience not to be missed!

title: I feel bad for fans
review:
I have never read any of the books before in my life. I have heard most of my information about Twilight from my friends who have summarized the books for me so I knew what was going on before I saw the movie. While I was watching it the first time, I thought it was great. I laughed at some of the parts a couple of times...such as the facial expressions on Edwards face, some of the cheesy lines, and the interesting choice of visual effects. But overall, it was great.

That was only the first time I saw it.

I then read the book and began comparing the movie to the book. It was amazing how absolutely wrong I was about the movie. The book sort of completed everything and pulled all the pieces and emotions together. I then went to go see the movie once more with a die hard fan of the series and almost felt embarrassed at the fact that I had told her only a week before how amazing the movie was! I really did feel ashamed for what I had said and sure enough, she was completely disappointed and I felt like I didn't do my job at warning her before we saw it.

We both agree: the visual effects and the poor writing were the biggest downfalls of the movie. I almost want to cry because I feel so bad for the author of the books and also for the die hard fans. I think my 7 year old cousin could write a better script and make better visual effects.

I really hope they decide to take their time on the sequels and do it right. I heard that they fired the director? I hope so! That would be the only way you could get me to see the following movies...considering I will be reading the rest of the books within that time!

title: A laughable drama for teenage girls
review: This movie is laughable. Bad dialogue, bad acting, cheesy (though entertaining) special effects. Teenage girls will love it, though, because Stephenie Meyer wrote a trashy romance novel and made it into a teenage fantasy film just for them. It's just a shame "grown" women are obsessed with it as well.

title: A decent narrative to the story
review: Being the first part, as expected it was informative enough. But as the movie progresses; it digs deep into the theme:how the two get together. And very soon the audience will have no doubt in them being a couple.The remarks about the film are almost positive. The audience will be satisfied about how the fantasy that surrounded the film's theme was portrayed. My honest opinion is I am fine with the film because the entirety of it was not shown in the first part itself. I started loving it after watching 3 parts. But the soul of the film and how the characters carried it step by step was the one thing that got me attracted to it. Despite average performances, the film was good enough for me. It will be so much enjoyable for anyone who can appreciate pure love and the characteristics it has. I seriously recommend the film even though it isn't satisfying enough because as you go through the further parts; you will savor every moment and this films helps you in that experience.

title: The ultimate fantasy love story!
review:
It's very simple: if you're a guy, don't watch it! If you're are girl, watch it!!! Especially if you're just a tiny bit romantic, chances are you will love this movie!!
It's clear from the mediocre score on IMDb and the many bad reviews that there is this hate culture around this movie (most likely from people who aren't the target audience, such as males), but there is a reason why it became so crazy popular.

title: Meh
review: The only thing good about these films are their soundtracks.

title: Great Continuous Movement of Interesting Dialogue
review:
I'm very analytical and moreover I also need mental stimulation and this move kept me interested. It can't be too much speaking or I can possibly lose interest. But, on the other hand, sometimes, I can watch a movie with a lot of speaking it, depending on my mood and the time of day I'm watching the movie. Normally those are the movies that I will set aside to watch on a late night or early morning because I know that it is gonna need my undivided focus in order to keep up.
However, I believe that Twilight has just the right balance in their dialogue pitch, allowing it to be watched any time of the day, because even if you do miss something, you wont feel lost. You can just jump right in! and feel like you're part of the movie.
This one has been added to my many movie collections that I can watch over, and over again.
But, I would like to know one thing...What is it that Edward smell on Bella when she entered the classroom and walked past the fan? This made me wonder if it was just her special scent or if she was possibly on her menstruation???

title: Pretty funny watching it now
review:
I first saw this movie when I was getting out of middle school and found it very boring, shallow, and not very good (the same feelings I hold for the other films). I have grown as a person and have learned a lot more about filmmaking in the years since it was release, are these films better now?

Upon revisiting, this is almost "so bad it's good". I can see now that the bad acting, hilarious effects, and awkward moments make this film kinda bearable now. (Edward "running" through the forest cracks me up every time).

It's still pretty boring and lame, I can't recommend sitting through it again, but it's a little more bearable now, I rank it the 3rd best in the franchise.

title: Sparkling Vampires
review:
Twilight is garbage. I'm not sure if there's been a film that I have cared less about. Like, I'm not even sure how to do a review; I guess I will list some of the blatant negatives, and maybe near the end I can scavenge for some redeemable quality.



I was so bored. I couldn't make it in one sitting; I had to take 2 breaks so that I didn't fall asleep. Now that I am typing that, I am regretting I didn't just sleep through it. I mean, I understand movies galore have an expositional setup for the first 15 minutes before getting into the meat of the film. Considering these vampires that drink the blood of animals are vegetarians, there's no meat on the bones of the film. To get a little more specific, as soon as Bella enters school halfway through the semester, everybody flocks to her and seems to know her already. Why?? I don't know! And to think that Edward would be compelled to Bella over Anna Kendrick may be the most glaring fault of all. Plus, the dialogue that goes on - and the directing with it-- is the least realistic thing I have ever seen. Nobody acts like they do. And I'm definitely looking at you Kristen Stewart, you sighing, breathing, half-laughing introvert you. For a girl that enjoys being alone, you spend the entire film with other people.



I was able to release a couple of chuckles at the movement of the vampires. Oh man, it was so cheesy...



And they shine bright like a diamond.



Seriously, what was this movie even about? I was about to dedicate this paragraph to the plot, but I have nothing to tell. If I wasn't zoning out at points in the film, I wish I was.



There's no motivation for the film, and it uses about 1 hour and 30 minutes to build a bond between the leads, establish friendships and villains, and put hints at conflicts to come; but really, it was just pointless because I didn't believe any of it. But Bella did. Oh, Edward, you've been watching me in my sleep for the past couple of months? That's cool. Before Bella figures out what Edward and his family really are, she pointlessly asks so many questions. It turns out she's right to have been questioning of everything, but she would've been an obsessed crazy person in any other normal situation - correction, in any other situation. Also, the first 45 minutes of gazing into Edward's eyes at school? I'm not sure if it was supposed to be mysterious or intimate, but it was just weird and uncomfortable.



I'd like to end on some sort of a high note. You somewhat find it in Bella's dad. I honestly believe he was the only rational character in the whole film. So kudos to you, Pops. You can find this review and dozens of others at gillipediamoviereviews.blogspot.com

review:
When I saw this movie someone on the facebook movie watch list.
I'll just thinking of it. and finally checked reviews and i found a girl with fallen love with vampire.
that's the time and now i became a big lover of this movie.

title: Twilight
review: The title of the film is "Twilight". It is fantasy. It is abaut love. It is based on book. The film is set in America. The film is set in modern times. Robert Pattinson stars in the film. Kristen Stewart plays the main role. Bella is my favorite character. My friend would like this film.

title: Great B grade with an even bigger budget
review: You have to see it, writhe with great clich√©s and cringe worthy moments. Just watch it from a b grade point of view and you'll love it Ugh 10 lines....OK My favourite moment is the enemy showing up after their stupid little baseball game (if you're using trapeze wires to play baseball you're doing it wrong by the way). The poses, the walk, OMG THE WALK, where they take 2 steps but manage to have traveled 15 meters! The stares, and attempt at evil glances is just embarrassing! Alright I agree with the idea that they don't want to hurt people so they're "vegetarians vampires" only feeding on animal blood, but that's it. Also Pasty face mister fantastic stops a car with one hand in the school Parking lot and no one around thinks that's odd? OK that's 10lines, enjoy your tripefest teen flick, but don't take it seriously

title: Good for preteen girls
review: Something I am not proud to admit: I was a huge Twilight fan in middle and early high school. Way before the movies, before even all the books were out. I am no longer a fan, but not because of the books or movies, but because of the hype. Twilight gets an awful lot of trash talk because it's cheesy and it's obsessed over by young girls. If cheesy supernatural romance is not your thing, don't bother. But also, don't mock the people who do enjoy it. They will come to see the error of their ways, you don't need to do it for them. I'm not summarizing the movie because I'm pretty sure everyone knows at least a bit about the plot, and probably more than they care to.

title: Weaker than Buffy on a size zero atkins diet
review:
I caught this on the the other day and it was just dreadful. The acting was hammy and then the story, well that's just an empty placeholder for hormonal teenagers to throw them selves into one the shells walking around the screen.

I thought the battle scenes were camp (the brilliant bit where they meet playing football and go into a mince-off) combined with duff acting from most of the players and the cheapo lumberjack special effect of running up a tree was very funny.

I heard the latter ones get better (as they pump the budget and big name actors in), but I think this may have passed me by. I think TV productions have better than this in terms of True Blood and Buffy. Plus big name films like Blade and Interview with the Vampire stand head and shoulders above. I understand its popular with a certain demographic, but outside that it struggles.

title: Nowhere near as bad as the rating suggests
review: I had never had any inclination to watch this film, however it was on TV and with nothing else to do I thought i'd give it a go. I wasn't expecting to like it but found myself getting involved in the story. The acting was so so but there was a certain chemistry between Pattinson and the beautiful Kristin Stewart. It is clearly aimed at the girl market but what's so wrong about that. I see that it has a poor IMDb rating but this is based purely on blokes voting it a 1 without seeing it, a clear case of voting snobbery. The film was entertaining throughout and well worth a view, as long as you are prepared to suspend belief and enjoy something for what it is rather than how cool you think it is to dislike it. I for one will be watching the sequels.

title: Birth of the Wicked
review:
Yet another movie the bad reputation of which arrived before its theatrical premiere and also a movie that after reading enough unfavorable reviews I decided to wait for to see until I'd be able to catch it on TV for free. Surprisingly, it turned out not be Bottom 100 material like Meet the Spartans, the TV premiere of which I sadly caught a while ago. However, by no means is this a good movie either. And I approached it with an open mind.

Most negative *criticism* directed towards this movie is deserved. One of the most common is lousy acting. Now, when this was made, the main cast were all nobodies, so it was easy to blame director Hardwicke, especially as she handles the acting-free sequences so amateurishly. But, *who* do we have among the cast?

Sarah Clarke - we definitely know she can act. Ironically, though she practically has about as much roles done at the time of filming than the others put together, her part is a blink-an-you'll-miss-it. I guess proved talent costs.

Elizabeth Reaser - another veteran, charismatic and likable, whose work on Grey's Anatomy was really good and whose own TV series, The Ex List, was unjustly canceled. Not surprisingly, she too has a very small part.

Anna Kendrick - a mere year later proving in Up in the Air that she has the talent and it cannot possibly have developed in one year, thus vindicating herself of this mess.

Ashley Greene - among all the woodenness, she too struggles against the bland script and manages to convey that she's not hopeless like the utterly talentless, and worse, charisma-free Stewart and Pattinson.

Like Stewart and Pattinson, Lautner shows no talent either, but at least he has charisma that combined with his abs should guarantee him work for at least a decade. Frak, he could develop from beefcake into a serious actor just like Brad Pitt.

Most of the movie is so flat it isn't even unintentionally funny - except for the Bad Guys, who are laughable walking clich√©s. Even their entrance proper during the baseball game is laughable! Sure, the movie is based on a cheap, sanitized, dumbed-down, marketable-for-teens rip-off of the Sookie Stackhouse books by Charlaine Harris, so screenwriter Rosenberg cannot perform miracles on Meyer's weak source material. But it's really shocking how bad Burwell's music is, considering he already had in his accomplished CV the scores for, among others, No Country for Old Men, Adaptation., Three Kings, Being John Malkovich and The Big Lebeowski. Together with the ill-judged pop music songs it only serves to amplify the movie's weaknesses. Maybe Burwell wasn't inspired by the imagery and created music that would be on par with the other aspects of the movie.

There is one thing many of the movie's critics are wrong about: vampires and daylight. The original myth and Bram Stoker's book Dracula tell of vampires being able to walk in sunlight. The "sunlight kills" was Hammer Horror films' so pervasive an addition to the "rules" that most people cannot be but baffled if they see a vampire in sunlight. So, at least Twilight gets something right.

In the end, however, what we have here is a sluggish, less-than-average 3/10 movie that is just a waste of time. It's not painful like Meet the Spartans, but it isn't even close to being a Harry Potter, either, let alone The Lord of the Rings.

title: Sh*t happens.
review: Damn....Goddamn.... this Movie, I wanted to throw my eyeballs at it! disappointed doesn't even begin to cover my feelings for this movie. Watching a horse take a fecal dump is more exiting than seeing this piece of garbage of a movie and that's not saying much. What can I say, crappy, cheesy and sad excuse for a vampire novel. the Character Bella Swan is a mary-sue who can't do a thing for herself because she is always dependent on her abusive sparklepire for a boyfriend. and the way that Edward stalks her as she sleeps, definite show of pedophilia right there. this movie was flat out horrible. Watching a horse or cow take a fecal dump is more exiting and more epic than this movie. just Avoid it at all costs. If your girlfriend wants to watch it, you'd be better off breaking up right away.

title: romanticism
review:
This was actually a very good surprise. I was prepared to hate this film. The books appeared as half-baked teen stuff, empty and just made to capitalize on the doors to otherworldliness as Harry Potter defined it to the XXI century: strange beings, odd variations on our real world, and a link to this same world, that makes the story and characters appear as if they could really exist, thus engaging more the audiences to whom this is intended. This Twilight series had an extra dullness that put me away: it revolved on the "fantasy" clich√©s, and to that, added the vampire film world. So it was playing safe twice.

The one thing that truly fails is the male character casting. Robert Pattinson is a stain here, he has no presence whatsoever. He throws his lines as if he was sitting in a toilet, his facial expression is bloodless, but not in a vampiresque fashion, his pose is artificial, although that works for his character (lucky there). I think they wanted to capitalize the actor who had had a short yet emotional character in the Potter series, and thus attract even more of the audiences of Potter. On the other hand, Kristen Stewart was a nice surprise. I don't know if she'll get out well of the teen movie world, but i'll be wanting to watch new things from her. She was tense in an unstressed way that usually we don't have in such young actresses.

But what i did like was the general mood chosen to this film. There is a very sweet and tense sense of romanticism that goes through the film, and that's what really caught my attention. It's a genuinely not corny melancholy, where the growing adolescent feelings between vampire and human take a sweet place at the center of the narrative. Regular readers of my comments know and appreciate such films which can convincingly build and sustain a mood, like an invisible glow which surrounds every element of the film. Wong Kar-Wai is the all-time master of this. So i care about trying to understand what produces such effect. Here i think the first anchor of this mood is Stewart and her controlled, intense performance (i wonder if she learned it from Foster). The second anchor is the cinematography and the very well succeeded choice of colors and sets. But the most important thing is the camera work. The hand held camera in the closeups while the lovers have dialogs are really something of superior class. Editing helps, but how the shots were conceived really works well. Some dialog moments are worthy of some bits of some Lumet's films. That is saying a lot.

My opinion: 3/5

http://www.7eyes.wordpress.com

title: why do people even like this movie?
review: im from asia and in 2008 i heard about 'twilight'.saw the trailer on national TV and found out that a lot of people loved this movie.i knew nothing about twilight,i didn't even know that it was actually a book.all the hype made me wanna see it.after searching for it for months i got a dvdrip of twilight through my friends.i actually thought it was gonna be a great movie but man did it suck!. when i saw the first scene i was like is that a movie or a TV series,cause it honestly looked like a low budget movie.i thought the movie was going to get better after few scenes but it didn't.i just couldn't figure out what was the point of twilight.cause it wasn't romantic,it wasn't thrilling,it was really boring.i got nothing against romantic movies,but this wasn't even romantic.it didn't make me cry or made me laugh,it didn't have good action sequences or mind blowing cgi.whats the point of this movie.cause i felt nothing watching it.and robbert pattinson's acting was terrible,one of the worst performances i have ever seen.he looked like some creep suffering from flu or something,cause he was shivering during the entire movie and the way he asks bella 'are you afraid',that made me laugh.i was like really?.i mean this movie disappointed the hell outta me.i love movies with depth like the shawshank redemption but i also like popcorn flicks a bit,but this wasn't even a popcorn flick cause it was boring.it didn't look like 'hollywood' at all.and i mean come on,the only reason we know these people are vampires is because they say so,you don't even get to see them sucking blood.and special effects were below average.im still trying to figure out why people like this movie so much cause clearly it doesn't make you think,nor it does entertain you.i would have liked twilight if it was the only movie i had seen in my life. my rating 4/10

title: Nothing will be the same.
review:
The fact that this has become a full blown pop culture phenomenon baffles me to no end, it's not that good. The story is very simple, a moody and pale teenager named Bella Swan from Phoenix, Arizona decides to live with her father for a while in Forks, Washington. Bella seems to draw the other teenagers like flies as they try to be friendly and several of the guys seem to like her. Honestly, this surprises me because Bella is pretty bland. She takes notice in some strange high school students. One of them is Edward Cullen and he and Bella don't seem to getting along.
