The only character miscast for me was Laurent. He was a very dominant, suave personality in the book. You are supposed to believe he was the leader of this pack (even though it is James) and James and Victoria are just his naughty brood. I could barely believe this character was even a vampire.

I will go see this again and will wait patiently, re-reading the books, for the next movie.

title: Well.
review:
I'm not gonna lie, I expected this movie to be horrible. When I walked in, at 3:00, to see Twilight, it was filled with little teens. I thought, "Great." Once the movie started, I kept hearing girly screams. When the Cullens walked into the cafeteria, the people behind me almost popped my ear drums. So, I couldn't watch or hear the movie from that point on. I saw it later that night when all the girls went to sleep or something. Well, I thought it was cute. It could've been way better. Edward and Bella's relationship seemed... too... rushed. They could've made it a little longer to build up their relationship. For one, they could've eaten lunch together. Go through the "blood type" chapter. And so much more. I thought Jasper was perfect. Bella was perfect. But, Edward needed some work. I just couldn't believe what he was saying.

The lion and lamb part, was just... cheesy. Edward just blurts it out, making it sound... unmeaningful. I honest to God think it could've been made much much better.

All in all, It was... okay and cute. So, if you want to see a cute short movie, with a good plot, with alright acting, go and see twilight.

Read the book first.

title: Decent! =)
review:
I have read all 4 of the books and LOVED them. I think Catherine did an okay job as a director, but I'd rather have someone a little more...experienced? I'm not sure. I don't know if I care for her style much.

Edward= He is delicious. His facial expressions when he met Bella for the first time were odd, but then he got into it and was great.

Bella= pretty good...she has an annoying eyebrow and I can't figure out if it was her doing that on purpose or if she just got a bad wax. She grew on me quite a bit, actually, toward the end. I still don't think that any female is going to care for her character much based on the fact that she gets to swap spit with Edward.

Overall= Some acting was a biiiit woody here and there (Tyler. Poor poor Tyler. It's called acting, buddy. I think I could have done better than you),some of the effects were massively cheesy (see the running. *headshake* Come on, guys. You had a decent budget.), there were a few cut scenes that were weird (Olde-tyme Bella laying out on a couch with Olde-tyme Edward biting her neck in SEPIA?!? WTF?), and I wish the other characters (Alice, Jasper, Emmett) got more speaking time. But I came out with a BIG smile and the need to see it over and over again, and the thought of going however many months without it being on DVD makes me a little sad.

Oh, but on a kind of negative note--I hate when people whine about when a movie's not exactly like the book. Oh, granted, there were a few things where i was like "What?! That doesn't happen here!! This doesn't even happen!!", but I'm gonna go with at least 95% of it was in the book, and the 5% that wasn't in it, probably didn't NEED to be in there, but it was fine; it made sense and it kept the story progressing. And of course the characters aren't going to look exactly how they do in your head--but I'm sure that Stephanie Meyer probably got pretty decent influence on the casting and maybe the script? I read that she was happy with how it turned out--I do feel bad that some people were upset with it. That sucks; I went in with a "hopefully it'll be awesome but if it's not...well...the books are still good." thought process.

I think people get too sucked into the thought that it's a "BOOK TURNED INTO A MOVIE" thing. But I totally understand when you get kind of disappointed in a movie because it's not how you thought it would be--but there's no need to be cruel or anything about it. I wasn't fond of the few things I noted above, and Jasper's facial expressions were HILARIOUS when they probably shouldn't have been, and when Edward first saw Bella was proooobably the weirdest look I've seen in a while on screen, but if you just watch the movie and don't focus on the book connection, it's definitely worthwhile.

title: Unevenly paced, but enjoyable
review:
I have read every single Twilight book, and the book I've read the most is, of course, Twilight itself. I went with a friend- I went into the movie with expectations, and my friend went in with no expectations. Maybe that's why I notice the problems more than she does.

My biggest issue with this movie is the pacing. There was no buildup to "So the lion fell in love with the lamb", and I seriously couldn't believe it when it happened. No chemistry up until that point.

However, after you realized they were a couple, it became easier to handle. The scene following the confession of love (Edward wearing sunglasses) is sweet. I love when Edward is in a good mood, but his melodrama through the movie was hard to handle (however, that is not the movie's fault, but the book's).

The ending was very confusing. That's all there is to say about that.

The best part about Twilight, by FAR, was the astounding soundtrack. I probably will buy it.
